titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John F. Aiken lecture transcriptions 1977.660
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:34 +0000.

did.abstract: The collection consists of two manuscript copies of a lecture by John F. Aiken, The Life and Poems of Tasso, delivered at the Long Island Historical Society (later known as the Brooklyn Historical Society) on April 6, 1865.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); John F. Aiken lecture transcriptions, 1977.660, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1977.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of two manuscript copies of a lecture by John F. Aiken, The Life and Poems of Tasso, delivered at the Long Island Historical Society (later known as the Brooklyn Historical Society) on April 6, 1865.
